quotes.quote: If the facts don't fit the theory, change the facts.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored.
quotes.author: Aldous Huxley

quotes.quote: Where facts are few, experts are many.
quotes.author: Donald R. Gannon

quotes.quote: Get the facts, or the facts will get you. And when you get them, get them right, or they will get you wrong.
quotes.author: Dr. Thomas Fuller

quotes.quote: Generally the theories we believe we call facts, and the facts we disbelieve we call theories.
quotes.author: Harper Lee

quotes.quote: Delete the adjectives and [you'll] have the facts.
quotes.author: Jawaharlal Nehru

quotes.quote: Facts are facts and will not disappear on account of your likes.
quotes.author: John Adams

quotes.quote: Facts are stubborn things; and whatever may be our wishes, our inclinations, or the dictates of our passion, they cannot alter the state of facts and evidence.
quotes.author: John Dewey

quotes.quote: We can have facts without thinking but we cannot have thinking without facts.
quotes.author: John Gunther

quotes.quote: Count Hermann Keyserling once said truly that the greatest American superstition was belief in facts.
quotes.author: John Henry Cardinal Newman

quotes.quote: Let us take things as we find them: let us not attempt to distort them into what they are not. We cannot make facts. All our wishing cannot change them. We must use them.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Get your facts first, and then you can distort them as much as you please.
quotes.author: Richard Brinsley Sheridan

quotes.quote: He is indebted to his memory for his jests and to his imagination for his facts.
quotes.author: Ronald Reagan

quotes.quote: The trouble with facts is that there are so many of them.
Facts have a cruel way of substituting themselves for fancies. There is nothing more remorseless, just as there is nothing more helpful, than truth.
